venue.name: Botswana International University of Science and Technology

events.name: Android Dev Days

venue.name: Botswana International University of Science and Technology

events.description:
Android Dev Days will bring your local developer community together to experience talks, in-depth product demos and behind-the-scenes interview on Android. The event can also offer other unique activities for developers, such cloud codelabs and a hackathon.

This year we have amazing giveaways from JetBrains!

events.name: Women Techmakers Chat
events.description: The event is targeted to raise more awareness about problems that women encounter within the technology career path of life in different societies. The event will entail motivational speeches and career guidance talks. The purpose of this event is to get more women and girls interested in technology and developing and also be able to find guidance in their areas of focus. We plan on having one on one chat with our guest speakers after the event to allow all the attendees to ask questions on a personal base. The expected impact is to have more women participating in the development side of technology as well as other areas of technology without the fear of unknown problems that they may encounter on the long run knowing that they are other women in the same industry that persevered through the same situation and made it to the end. The main purpose of this chat is to bridge gender parity and also motivate women to take part in technology related atmospheres. The chat will also allow attendees to exchange ideas as well as create a networking platform for women in the technology field. It is the first Women TechMakers event ever to be hosted with the aim of bringing together women who are technology curious and even those who are interested in technology but are not sure of which direction their first step is to be directed to. This Profession Building Chat is also an opportunity for young ,aspiring women techies to learn more about how technology can be integrated to better ones future as well as have time to interact with influential women, and also acquire knowledge

events.name: Kotlin Night Gaborone
events.description:
Kotlin Night is a meetup that includes 3-4 talks on Kotlin or related technologies.

GDG Gaborone, with the support of Jetbrains, will be hosting the first ever Kotlin Night to share with developers insights on how to develop apps using Kotlin

events.description:

Google Developer Group Gaborone would like to invite you to a hackathon on the 2nd of December as part of it's contribution to the 16 days against gender based violence and more importantly a support to the motion to be tabled by parliament on the need for a sexual offenders registry.

events.name: NovTech IWD 3.0
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.
• What we'll do
NovTech IWD[masked] SADC Edition will be the third event in the NovTech series of events and the first ever Women TechMakers summit to be hosted by GDG Gaborone with GDG Francistown, GDG Harare, GDG HIT, GDG Blantyre and GDG Windhoek. These chapters are collaborating to bring together women from these countries with the aim of motivating them to be part of the community developments through the use of Google technologies. The motivation will be through speeches, talks, individual consultation and hands on (practical) sessions. The purpose of this event is to get more women and girls interested in technology and how technology impacts our community. We plan on introducing fundamental Google technologies to women as well as developing an interest in these platforms. The theme this year is "Building a New Horizon"

• What to bring
Notebook, laptop, stressball

events.name: I/O Extended Gaborone 2018
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 Google I/O Extended Gaborone 2018, an extended event to the recently ended Google I/O 2018. This event will highlight the stories of our growing a community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs most coming from the just ended Google I/O 2018. We will also have a recap of Google I/O from Kesego Tumisang, who attended this year's I/O.
• What we'll do
We will be watching the keynotes from Google I/O
We will be running codelabs on Firebase, Flutter and Kotlin
Be prepared to build apps on Flutter, intergrate Firebase as well as use Kotlin to write you Android applications

•Interim Agenda: What to look out for
Developer Keynote: 09:15 - 10:15
Introduction to Flutter 10:25 - 11:00
Kotlin for Beginners 11:00 - 11:40

Code lab Session 1: 11:40 - 12:45
Room 1: Write your first Flutter App Part 1 & 2
Room 2: Build Your First Android App in Kotlin

LUNCH: 12:45 - 14:00
Code lab 2: 14:00 - 15:05
Room 1: Firebase for Flutter
Room 2: Firebase with Kotlin

Panel Chat and Open Mic 15:05 - 15:30
Women in Tech Entrepreneurship 15:30 - 16:00
Questions And Answers (Interactional Session) 16:00 - 17:00
AFTER SESSION: App Demos reviews 17:00 till late

• What to bring
Notebook, laptop, stressball
events.how_to_find_us: Find us by the Library Auditorium, there will be signage all around campus to direct you

Radiant.Earth provides a geospatial technology platform that supports knowledge transfer to positively impact the developing world’s greatest social, economic and environmental challenge
Help us by filling this pre worksop survey https://radiantearth.typeform.com/to/EZQHxL

events.name: Flutter StudyJam Gaborone 1
events.description:
Flutter is the Google Mobile Application SDK for creating high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time.

Want to start creating Flutter applications?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together, we will work on the Flutter Udacity Course, prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to gain hands-on experience with Flutter and create a Flutter application while learning the basics.

What to bring

To get the best experience, bring your own laptop with Flutter installed before starting the study jam and also to save time. Here is the link https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

events.name: DevFest Southern Africa 2018

venue.name: Botswana Innovation Hub
venue.address_1: 69184 Botswana Innovation Hub Science and Technology Park, Block 8

events.description:
GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more! After a successful GDG Southern Africa 2017 in Harare, Zimbabwe, we wanted to bring back the fire, this time in Gaborone, Botswana.
We are expecting developers, designers and entrepreneurs from all over Southern Africa, along with some Googlers and Google Developer experts in the area.

1. Mobile ( Kotlin & Flutter)
2. Web
3. Machine Learning
4. IoT ( Android Things)
5. Cloud (Firebase & GCP)

On the night of the 9th of November we plan to host the Women Techmakers welcome cocktail to build momentum for women participation throughout the Devfest
events.how_to_find_us: From Bus rank, Get Block 8 Route 3 and get off by Airport Junction Mall, from there catch Block 8 route 4 and tell the driver you are going to Botswana Innovation Hub

events.name: Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger! :)

events.name: Flutter & Firebase Weekend

• Important to know

There will be giveaways so don't miss out!

events.name: 4IR Minus the Buzz
events.description: The 4IR is surely buzzing, but is it a buzz thing? This is a pertinent question as 4IR is treated like an intellectual discourse in most forums hence is discussed in esoteric terms - Internet of Things, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Augmented Reality, Additive Manufacturing, Cloud Computing, Edge Computing etc. The event aims to demystify 4IR for everyone including non-technical people. Come and attend the event to gain insight on the 4IR from a developing country's perspective - with sustainability in mind.
events.how_to_find_us: We will be at the Library Auditorium

events.name: Hacktoberfest in Gaborone
events.description:
Description
It's Hacktoberfest 2019! Let's celebrate open source over food, drinks, learning, and great company!

What's Hacktoberfest?
Hacktoberfest — brought to you by DigitalOcean in partnership with DEV — is a month-long celebration of open source software. Maintainers are invited to guide would-be contributors towards issues that will help move the project forward, and contributors get the opportunity to give back to both projects they like and others they've just discovered. No contribution is too small — bug fixes and documentation updates are valid ways of participating.

Can't make it to this event? Hacktoberfest is virtual and open to participants from around the globe. Sign up to participate today.

Rules and prizes
First, sign up on the Hacktoberfest site at https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com. To qualify for the official limited edition Hacktoberfest shirt, you must register and make four pull requests between October 1-31. Pull requests can be to any public repo on GitHub, not just the ones with issues labeled Hacktoberfest. If a maintainer reports your pull request as spam or behavior not in line with the project’s code of conduct, you will be ineligible to participate.

Connect with other Hacktoberfest participants by using #hacktoberfest on your social media platform of choice.

New to DigitalOcean? Receive USD $50 in infrastructure credit at https://do.co/hacktoberfest50.

events.name: Computer Society of Botswana Symposium
events.description:
The Computer Society of Botswana is inviting you to its annual symposium scheduled for the 31 October 2019, to be held at the University of Botswana, Library Auditorium. This year theme is centered around the 4th Industrial Revolution (4IR) and the future of ICT.
The symposium will attract stakeholders from different organization government, Industry and Academia discussing various topics around the 4th Industrial Revolution and the impact society. Notably there will be extensive discussions on ICT skills development and showcasing Experts who are willing to engage with different stakeholders in improving the status quo in this country.

events.name: Flutter Interact: Viewing Party
events.description:
We’re holding a global party for Flutter, and we’d love you to be part of the celebration!

On Friday December 13th, we’re hosting Flutter Live Viewing party, following the Flutter Live in Brooklyn, NY on the 11th where we’ll share a variety of news and updates about the Flutter.

You ay walk away with a Dashlet and we still have Flutter swag to give away!

events.name: NovTech IWD 3.0 Gaborone 2020
events.description:
ABOUT

Novtech* International Women’s Day (IWD) is the biggest female focused technology event in Botswana carefully crafted for you by Google Women Techmakers within the GDG community as well as Facebook Developer Circles Gaborone and Women in Machine Learning & Data Science Gaborone!

TARGET DELEGATE
Females and progressive males that aspire to develop their tech skills

EVENT HIGHLIGHTS
- Tech talks
- Demos
- Panel Discussions

EVENT OBJECTIVES
NovTech* IWD 3.0 Gaborone 2020 will be our third event in the NovTech series of events which brings together women in tech to break down issues around women in technology as well as engage in strategies to prosper in this male dominated field.

Our goal is to inspire girls to continue in the field by showcasing and celebrating female success stories in the field.

*Novtech: Novice in technology

• What to bring
Notebook, laptop, stress ball
events.how_to_find_us: We will be at Fairground mall

events.name: Building Back - During and After Covid-19
events.description:
This is a first in what we hope to make into a series of webinars. Our first discussion will be on Coping, mental health, doubts, time constraints and personal growth during the pandemic and even after. How are we are dealing with it as innovators, programmers, techpreneurs, designers and researchers?

Special Guests
1. Kesego Mokgosi: Computer Systems Engineering student at Botswana Accountancy College, One of the 100 African DSC leads in the Developer Student Clubs Google Developers Program, Machine Learning enthusiast and works mostly as Conversational AI architect.

2. Tiro Modibedi: an Innovator by heart, Software Developer by Training, Tech Entrepreneur by deed and an Afrofuturist in thought. A self-taught Full-stack JavaScript Engineer with an extensive background in building fully functional responsive web and mobile applications.

3. Ivan Bila: a UX designer and software developer who participated in the development of products that were used by over 250,000 users. He currently works as a software developer at UX Information Technologies, where he helps maintain and develop products such as emprego.co.mz, emprego.co.ao, douleuw.gr, and biscate.co.mz.

4. Ofentse Rice: a tech enthusiast. She is the lead organiser of Women in Machine Learning and Data Science Gaborone and is also the Founder and CEO of Techy Kidz Academy.

group_profile.title: GDG Gaborone
group_profile.intro:
This Google Developer Group is a group for people who are interested and enthusiastic about Google's developer technologies.
Our goal is to provide an environment where people can learn, innovate and collaborate together in a social setting.
